cite.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to mention something as an example, especially one that supports, proves, or explains an idea or situation
cite.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The judge cited a 1956 Supreme Court ruling in her decision.
Several factors have been cited as the cause of the unrest.
cite.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to give the exact words of something that has been written, especially in order to support an opinion or prove an idea
cite.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The passage cited above is from a Robert Frost poem.
cite.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to order someone to appear before a court of law
cite.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Two managers had been cited for similar infractions.
cite.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to mention someone by name in a court case
cite.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Sue was cited in the divorce proceedings.
cite.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: to mention someone because they deserve praise
cite.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Garcia was cited for her work with disabled children.
cite.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to mention something as an example, especially in order to support, prove, or explain what you are saying
cite.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The report cites the case of Sweden, where following the liberalization of the postal service, around 1,000 new jobs were created.
